revisions.rev:
This article describes the '''history of [[Microsoft Office]]''' and its versions. == Mac versions == [[Image:Office 2008 Folder.png|thumb|128px|right|Office for Mac 2008 folder]] {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" ! Package Name !! Applications and comments !! Release Date |- | Office 1 | Word 3, etc. | August 1, [[1989]] |- | Office 2 | Word 4, etc. | [[1992]] |- | Office 3 | Word 5, Excel 4, PowerPoint 3, etc. | [[1993]] |- | Office 4.2 | Word 6, Excel 5, PowerPoint 4, etc. | [[1994]] |- | Office 4.2.1 | Word 6, Excel 5, PowerPoint 4, etc. (first release designed for the [[PowerPC|PPC]], final release for 68K) | [[1994]] |- | [[Microsoft Office 98 Macintosh Edition|Office 98]] (8.0) | Word/Excel/PowerPoint 98 | March 15, 1998 |- | [[Microsoft Office 2001|Office 2001]] (9.0) | Word/Excel/PowerPoint and Entourage 2001 (final release for Mac OS 9, latest update 9.0.6[http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=12473 Microsoft Office 2001 for Mac Security Update (9.0.6)]) | October 11, 2000 |- | [[Microsoft Office v. X|Office v. X]] (10.0) | Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Entourage X (first release for Mac OS X, latest update 10.1.9[http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=2415 Microsoft Office v. X for Mac 10.1.9 Update]) | November 19, 2001 |- | [[Office 2004 for Mac|Office 2004]] (11.0) | Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Entourage 2004 (latest update 11.6.4[http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=26350 Microsoft Office 2004 for Mac 11.6.4 Update]) | February 12, 2004 |- | [[Microsoft Office 2008 for Mac|Office 2008]] (12.0) | Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Entourage 2008 (the first release that runs natively on both PPC and Intel without the use of the Rosetta emulation layer, latest update 12.3.0[http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=26353 Microsoft Office 2008 for Mac 12.3.0 Update]) | January 15, 2008 |- | [[Microsoft Office for Mac 2011|Office 2011]] (14.0) | Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Outlook 2011 (first release for Intel only, latest update 14.1.2[http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=26435 Microsoft Office for Mac 2011 14.1.2 Update]) | October 26, 2010 |} == Windows versions == === Timeline === {| class=wikitable !Release date !! Title/version !! Contents !! Notes |- |November 19, 1990{{cite news|title=The Microsoft Office for Windows Advertisement|newspaper=InfoWorld|date=November 19, 1990|page=50|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=wFAEAAAAMBAJ&lpg=PA1&pg=PA50#v=onepage&q&f=false}} |Office 1.0 |Word 1.1, Excel 2.0, PowerPoint 2.0{{cite news|title= Office for Windows Bundles Popular Microsoft Applications|newspaper=InfoWorld|last=Johnston|first= Stuart J.|date=October 1, 1990|page=16|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=VTwEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PT17}} | |- |March 4, 1991{{cite news|title=Microsoft ships updated Office for Windows|newspaper=InfoWorld|date=March 4, 1991|page= 16|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=rlAEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PT15}} |Office 1.5 |Word 1.1, Excel 3.0, PowerPoint 2.0 | |- |July 8, 1991{{cite news|title=The Microsoft Office for Windows 1.6 Advertisement|newspaper=InfoWorld|date=July 8, 1991|pages=18â19|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=iVAEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA18}} |Office 1.6 |Word 1.1, Excel 3.0, PowerPoint 2.0, Mail 2.1 | |- |August 30, 1992 |[[Microsoft Office 3.0|Office 3.0]] |CD-ROM version: Word 2.0c, Excel 4.0a, PowerPoint 3.0, Mail |Later rebranded as Office 92 |- |January 17, 1994 |Office 4.0 |Word 6.0, Excel 4.0, PowerPoint 3.0. | |- |June 2, 1994 |Office 4.3 |Word 6.0, Excel 5.0, PowerPoint 4.0, Mail 3.2 and in the Pro version, Access 2.0. |This is the last 16-bit version. This is also the last version to support Windows 3.x, Windows NT 3.1 and Windows NT 3.5 (Windows NT 3.51 was supported up to and including Office 97). |- |July 3, 1994 |Office for NT 4.2 |Word 6.0 and Excel 5.0 (both 32-bit, i386, MIPS, PowerPC, and Alpha), PowerPoint 4.0 (16-bit), "Microsoft Office Manager". | |- |August 30, 1995 |[[Microsoft Office 95|Office 95]] (7.0) |Word 7 for Windows 95, etc. |Coincided with the [[Windows 95]] operating system release. Works only on Windows 95, NT 3.51 or higher. This is the first Office version to have the same version number (7.0, inherited from Word 6.0) for all major component products (Word, Excel and so on). |- |December 30, 1996 |[[Microsoft Office 97|Office 97]] (8.0) |Word 97, etc. |Was published on [[CD-ROM]] as well as on a set of 45 3Â½-inch [[floppy disks]]), became [[Y2K]] safe with Service Release 2. Last version to support [[Windows NT 3.51]] on i386 and Alpha. |- |June 20, 1998 |Office 97 Powered by Word 98 (8.5) |The only way to get Word 98. |Was released only in Japanese and Korean editions. First version to contain Outlook 98 in all editions and Publisher 98 in the Small Business Edition. And also the first version of Office 97 to support Windows 98. |- |January 27, 1999 |[[Microsoft Office 2000|Office 2000]] (9.0) |Word 2000, etc. |Last version to support [[Windows 95]]. Office 2000 is also the last version which does not include [[Product Activation]] and is not covered by [[Office Genuine Advantage]], although on individual installs, the Office Update website still required the presence of original install media for updates to install. |- |May 31, 2001 |[[Microsoft Office XP|Office XP]] (10.0) |Word 2002, etc. |Last version to support [[Windows 98]]/[[Windows Me|Me]]/[[Windows NT 4.0|NT 4.0]]. Improved support for working in restricted accounts under [[Windows 2000]]/[[Windows XP|XP]]. |- |November 17, 2003 |[[Microsoft Office 2003|Office 2003]] (11.0) |Word 2003, etc. |First version to introduce Windows XP style icons. Last version to support [[Windows 2000]]. |- |January 30, 2007 |[[Microsoft Office 2007|Office 2007]] (12.0) |Word 2007, etc. |Broadly released alongside [[Windows Vista]]. |- |June 15, 2010{{cite web|url=http://www.informationweek.com/news/software/enterpriseapps/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=215600338|title=Microsoft Opens Office 14 Kimono, Slightly|last=Hoover|first=J. Nicholas|date=2009-03-02|accessdate=2009-03-03|publisher=[[InformationWeek]]}} |[[Microsoft Office 2010|Office 2010]] (14.0) | |There will be no Microsoft Office 13 due to [[triskaidekaphobia|superstition]]. This is the first version to ship in 32- and 64-bits.[http://apcmag.com/5753/microsoft_gets_to_work_on_office_2009 Microsoft to skip "unlucky" Office 13] |} === Editions === ==== Office 4.x ==== {|class="wikitable" !'''Standard''' !'''Professional''' |- |align="center"|Word |align="center"|Word |- |align="center"|Excel |align="center"|Excel |- |align="center"|PowerPoint |align="center"|PowerPoint |- |align="center"|Mail |align="center"|Mail |- |align="center"| |align="center"|Access |} ==== Office 95 ==== {|class="wikitable" !'''Standard''' !'''Professional''' |- |align="center"|Word 95 (7.0) |align="center"|Word 95 (7.0) |- |align="center"|Excel 95 (7.0) |align="center"|Excel 95 (7.0) |- |align="center"|PowerPoint 95 (7.0) |align="center"|PowerPoint 95 (7.0) |- |align="center"|Schedule+ 95 (7.0) |align="center"|Schedule+ 95 (7.0) |- |align="center"| |align="center"|Access 95 (7.0) |} ==== Office 97 ==== {|class="wikitable" !'''Standard''' !'''Professional''' !'''Small Business''' !'''Developer''' |- |align="center"|Word 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Word 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Word 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Word 97 (8.0) |- |align="center"|Excel 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Excel 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Excel 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Excel 97 (8.0) |- |align="center"|Outlook 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Outlook 97 (8.0) |align="center"|Outlook 98 (8.5) |align="center"|Outlook 9?
